title: Rotating circular loop in magnetic field

content.question: A circular loop of wire in a uniform magnetic field rotates at a constant rotational speed about the axis shown. At time t = 0 the plane of the loop is parallel to the field with point P at the top as shown above left. At time t= t1 the loop has rotated 180Â° so that point P is at the bottom as shown above right. Which of the following graphs best represents the magnetic flux through the loop as a function of time t from 0 to t1 ?

choices.label: A graph denotes time on the x axis and flux on the y axis. The graph plots a curve that originates in the fourth quadrant on the negative y axis, rises gradually through the positive x axis, further rises into the first quadrant, and ends at a point with t equals t sub 1. The curve is concave up increasing in the fourth quadrant and concave down increasing in the first quadrant.

A graph denotes time on the x axis and flux on the y axis. The graph plots a curve that begins at the origin, rises as concave up increasing to a peak point in the first quadrant, and falls down to the point t sub 1 comma 0 as a concave down decreasing curve.

A graph denotes time on the x axis and flux on the y axis. The graph plots a wave shaped curve that begins at the origin, rises to a maximum in the first quadrant, falls through the x axis to a minimum point in the fourth quadrant, and further rises to the point t sub 1 comma 0.

A graph denotes time on the x axis and flux on the y axis. The graph plots a concave upward curve that originates in the first quadrant on the positive y axis, falls down to the positive x axis, and further to a point in the first quadrant with t equals t sub 1.

A graph denotes time on the x axis and flux on the y axis. The graph plots a concave downward curve that begins from the origin, rises to a point in the first quadrant, and falls down to the point t sub 1 comma 0.

content.answer: A graph denotes time on the x axis and flux on the y axis. The graph plots a concave downward curve that begins from the origin, rises to a point in the first quadrant, and falls down to the point t sub 1 comma 0.
